<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SMALL BIZ
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/15/warren-buffett-david-solomon-urge-congress-extend-ppp-small-businesses?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Oracle Warns of Big Problems for Small Businesses
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A photo of Warren Buffett from the shoulders up; He is standing in front of a turquoise background wearing a black pinstripe suit, red tie, and glasses. " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNDMxL3dhcnJlbl9idWZmZXR0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Daniel Zuchnik/WireImage via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In an interview with CNBC yesterday morning, legendary investor Warren Buffett <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/15/its-an-economic-war-warren-buffett-urges-congress-to-extend-relief-for-small-businesses.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">urged Congress</a> to pass legislation to help small businesses stay afloat.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Buffett called the situation facing Mom and Pop an "economic war," and labeled small businesses "collateral damage in a war that our country needed to fight." He called on Congress to extend the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) "on a large scale." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Remember the PPP? </strong>We <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/19/lawmakers-near-deal-refuel-ppp?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wrote about it</a> often during the worst of the economic crisis in March and April. It's a $525 billion government program intended to help small businesses keep workers on payroll. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>PPP has been criticized for </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/ppp-was-a-fraudster-free-for-all-investigators-say-11604832072?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fraud</a></span><span> and </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/12/11/ppp-sba-loans-sonic/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not actually going to small businesses</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But PPP may have been the economic equivalent of a vodka soda—imperfect but still effective. "Don't let that turn you away from something where millions of people were being helped," Buffett argued yesterday.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It's all about access to credit</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Large corporations have several funding options, such as the bond market, to tap into on a rainy day. And 2020, of course, has been <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/1ae439b1-75e7-4b55-876c-66533ac37db8?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">particularly stormy</a>: U.S. companies have sold a record $2.4 trillion of bonds so far this year, per Dealogic. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"Small businesses don't have that access," Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon told CNBC yesterday. Which is why he, too, supports another round of PPP funding. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">A real-world example: </strong>This summer, American Airlines was able to raise $2.5 billion from selling bonds even as it was bleeding $58 million/day. Much smaller GNS Foods, which supplies American Airlines with nuts, struggled to refinance a $500,000 mortgage on its warehouse, writes the Financial Times.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>a stimulus bill from a bipartisan group of lawmakers contains $300 billion in aid for small businesses, including devastated restaurants and entertainment venues. Help could be on the way if Congress gets the job done.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/15/anna-wintour-promoted-cond-nast?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Devil Runs Condé
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Meryl Streep as Miranda Priestly in The Devil Wears Prada " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=285 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l46CAeMR1XVgrpY5O/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Meryl Streep as Miranda Priestly in The Devil Wears Prada " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l46CAeMR1XVgrpY5O/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, print media titan Condé Nast <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/12/15/media/anna-wintour-conde-nast-promotion/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> that legendary fashion gatekeeper Anna Wintour will be elevated from U.S. Vogue editor/artistic director to reigning <span style="text-decoration: line-through;">Empress Of Stylishness</span> global chief content officer. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Wintour <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/vogues-anna-wintour-promoted-to-chief-content-officer-for-conde-nast-11608045300?mod=hp_lista_pos3&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">became</a> U.S. Vogue editor in 1988, then added the "artistic director" title in 2014. That means she's been helping steer a ship of the U.S.' most iconic glossies—including GQ, Vanity Fair, and Bon Appétit—through the slow but steady collapse of print media.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Condé has had its share of setbacks, especially this year (it laid off about 100 people in May as the pandemic hit), but it's in the midst of a turnaround plan. CEO Roger Lynch plans to lean on 1) digital video and 2) paywalls to reach profitability.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Condé's also </span><span><a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/carlieporterfield/2020/12/15/anna-wintour-promoted-to-cond-nast-chief-content-officer-despite-diversity-criticism/?sh=25e23fa37b41&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">still responding</a></span><span> to criticism over its treatment of Black employees, who have said they are marginalized. Wintour apologized for her role in sidelining Black creators in June. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Condé may be changing its ways, but its most influential face is staying put. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/15/eu-unveils-regulations-targeting-big-tech?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Big Tech vs. the EU, Round...We're Losing Count
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For a city whose symbol is a statue of a naked (or occasionally costumed) peeing child, Brussels doesn't mess around. Yesterday, European Union officials <a href="https://www.axios.com/eu-tech-restraints-gatekeepers-digital-services-markets-b7966063-aa23-4711-80f5-71c06a1aff6f.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released drafts</a> of two strict new regulations for big tech. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The <strong style="color:#000">Digital Markets Act</strong> gives companies with extra big reach—45+ million monthly users or 10,000+ business customers—extra attention. These "gatekeepers" would need to disclose planned takeovers, face limits on using data they collect to launch competing products, and avoid favoring their own products on their platforms.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Fines for violations could reach up to 10% of annual global revenue.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The <strong style="color:#000">Digital Services Act</strong> <a href="https://apnews.com/article/business-media-bills-social-media-19038a8f0a68448ce6037308930a5efc?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">would</a> make companies more accountable for illegal content on their platforms, with fines of up to 6% of annual revenue.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The walls are closing in</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This week, the FTC <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/amazon-facebook-among-targets-ftc-192247469.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ordered</a> top U.S. tech companies to explain their user data practices, China <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/12/13/china-literature-alibaba-fined/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fined</a> its own tech leaders Alibaba and Tencent over antitrust violations, and the UK <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/uk-plans-big-fines-online-companies-harmful-content-rcna198?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">proposed</a> fines of up to 10% of global revenue if tech giants don't remove illegal content.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the EU proposals still need to be ratified, which could take a few years. If they become law, they'll likely be Europe's strictest to date.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This holiday season, we aren’t just passing down our famous eggnog recipe, we’re also passing down the secret to building generational wealth—investing in private real estate with <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/483729397;290603989;h" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">DiversyFund</a>. </p>

<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="GIF of Mayor Pete Buttigieg saying hello " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Qve6HBxgvPw3BCdsFF/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">President-elect Joe Biden reportedly <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/12/15/politics/pete-buttigieg-transportation-secretary/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">made his pick</a> for Transportation Secretary yesterday: former mayor of South Bend, IN, Pete Buttigieg. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Remember, it's BOOT-edge-edge—and he's the young one who <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SxtvXaRe2lg&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">speaks Norwegian</a> and <a href="https://pitchfork.com/news/watch-pete-buttigieg-cover-spoons-the-way-we-get-by-on-piano/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">plays alt-rock</a> on the piano. Thirty-eight-year-old Mayor Pete ran a solid campaign for the Democratic nomination, even <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/biden-selects-pete-buttigieg-to-lead-transportation-department-11608059207?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">scraping out a win</a> in the Iowa caucuses, but eventually dropped out of the race.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Buttigieg endorsed Biden and helped him raise money, despite Biden having run an ad mocking Buttigieg's relatively paltry experience. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What Buttigieg will be tasked with: </strong>It may be the Rhodes Scholar's toughest assignment yet—bipartisan infrastructure legislation. Biden's plan for climate change, a central plank of his platform, includes a major effort to overhaul the U.S.' crumbling industrial backbone. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>More broadly, Buttigieg </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-15/biden-taps-former-rival-buttigieg-to-head-u-s-transportation?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will manage</a></span><span> a nearly $90 billion budget, plus oversee the agencies that regulate railroads, trucking, and aviation.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>if his nomination makes it through the Senate, Buttigieg will be the first openly LGBTQ person to become a member of a presidential Cabinet. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/15/nickelodeon-air-nfl-wild-card-game?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The NFL Comes to Nick
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A photoshopped image of Green Bay wide receiver Davante Adams flexing his arms; Spongebob's cartoon eyes are photoshopped onto Adams's helmeted head." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNDMwL25pY2tlbG9kZW9uLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>ViacomCBS</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We're not sure watching football could get more fun than Monday night's Browns-Ravens game, but Nickelodeon is going to try. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Jan. 10, the network will <a href="https://sports.yahoo.com/spongebob-slime-football-nickelodeon-ready-nfl-game-152833506--nfl.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">broadcast</a> an NFL Wild Card game filled with gags aimed at drawing in a younger audience. That means... </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A pregame show called "The SpongeBob SportsPants Countdown Special" </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Booth commentary from two members of the sketch comedy series </span><span><em>All That</em></span><span> </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Slime superimposed on endzones and googly eyes and other Snapchat-style filters layered over the game </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>With the all-important TV rights deals for the NFL expiring in 2022, media companies, such as Nickelodeon parent ViacomCBS, are <a href="https://variety.com/2020/tv/news/nfl-wild-card-nickelodeon-cbs-spongebob-squarepants-1234853731/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">experimenting</a> with new formats to woo the league. NBC, for instance, is tapping khaki influencer and MSNBC journalist Steve Kornacki to evaluate playoff scenarios as he would the electoral college. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Food for thought: </strong>Who makes your all-Nickelodeon football roster? </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>WRs: Drake & Josh</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>TE: Otto from </span><span><em>Rocket Power</em></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>RB: Wanda from </span><span><em>The </em></span><span><em>Fairly OddParents</em></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Fullback: Invader Zim</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Football: Hey Arnold's head</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>O-Line: The Rugrats </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>D-Line: The Wild Thornberrys</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>QB: Aang from </span><span><em>Avatar: the Last Airbender</em></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Backup QB: Danny Phantom</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Coaches: Gibby from </span><span><em>iCarly</em></span><span>, SpongeBob, and Ned from </span><span><em>Ned's Declassified School Survival Guide</em></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
ISO: Christmas Miracle
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="A Santa is seen in a coronavirus-safe plastic bubble at the Zoo in Aalborg, Denmark, on November 13, 2020." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNDI5L3NhbnRhX2NsYXVzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Henning Bagger/Ritzau Scanpix/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For Christmas market operators, prepping for the holidays is typically a year-long affair. There are spring orders for bespoke glühwein mugs to place, vendor applications to review, city permits to secure, staff to hire. But, as we all know, this wasn't a typical year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Brew spoke with operators of four of the U.S.' most iconic Christmas markets about their decisions to proceed in-person or move festivities online, and the devastating impact the pandemic is having on your favorite Christmas ornament artisan.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/15/christmas-markets-need-christmas-miracle?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check out the full story here</a>. </p>
</td>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nSMALL BIZ\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/15/warren-buffett-david-solomon-urge-congress-extend-ppp-small-businesses?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThe Oracle Warns of Big Problems for Small Businesses\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"A photo of Warren Buffett from the shoulders up; He is standing in front of a turquoise background wearing a black pinstripe suit, red tie, and glasses. \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNDMxL3dhcnJlbl9idWZmZXR0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eDaniel Zuchnik/WireImage via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn an interview with CNBC yesterday morning, legendary investor Warren Buffett \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/15/its-an-economic-war-warren-buffett-urges-congress-to-extend-relief-for-small-businesses.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eurged Congress\u003c/a\u003e to pass legislation to help small businesses stay afloat.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBuffett called the situation facing Mom and Pop an \"economic war,\" and labeled small businesses \"collateral damage in a war that our country needed to fight.\" He called on Congress to extend the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) \"on a large scale.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRemember the PPP? \u003c/strong\u003eWe \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/19/lawmakers-near-deal-refuel-ppp?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrote about it\u003c/a\u003e often during the worst of the economic crisis in March and April. It's a $525 billion government program intended to help small businesses keep workers on payroll. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003ePPP has been criticized for \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/ppp-was-a-fraudster-free-for-all-investigators-say-11604832072?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efraud\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e and \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/12/11/ppp-sba-loans-sonic/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enot actually going to small businesses\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut PPP may have been the economic equivalent of a vodka soda—imperfect but still effective. \"Don't let that turn you away from something where millions of people were being helped,\" Buffett argued yesterday.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIt's all about access to credit\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLarge corporations have several funding options, such as the bond market, to tap into on a rainy day. And 2020, of course, has been \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/1ae439b1-75e7-4b55-876c-66533ac37db8?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eparticularly stormy\u003c/a\u003e: U.S. companies have sold a record $2.4 trillion of bonds so far this year, per Dealogic. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\"Small businesses don't have that access,\" Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon told CNBC yesterday. Which is why he, too, supports another round of PPP funding. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eA real-world example: \u003c/strong\u003eThis summer, American Airlines was able to raise $2.5 billion from selling bonds even as it was bleeding $58 million/day. Much smaller GNS Foods, which supplies American Airlines with nuts, struggled to refinance a $500,000 mortgage on its warehouse, writes the Financial Times.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003ea stimulus bill from a bipartisan group of lawmakers contains $300 billion in aid for small businesses, including devastated restaurants and entertainment venues. Help could be on the way if Congress gets the job done.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, print media titan Condé Nast \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/12/15/media/anna-wintour-conde-nast-promotion/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e that legendary fashion gatekeeper Anna Wintour will be elevated from U.S. Vogue editor/artistic director to reigning \u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: line-through;\"\u003eEmpress Of Stylishness\u003c/span\u003e global chief content officer. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eWintour \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/vogues-anna-wintour-promoted-to-chief-content-officer-for-conde-nast-11608045300?mod=hp_lista_pos3\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebecame\u003c/a\u003e U.S. Vogue editor in 1988, then added the \"artistic director\" title in 2014. That means she's been helping steer a ship of the U.S.' most iconic glossies—including GQ, Vanity Fair, and Bon Appétit—through the slow but steady collapse of print media.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCondé has had its share of setbacks, especially this year (it laid off about 100 people in May as the pandemic hit), but it's in the midst of a turnaround plan. CEO Roger Lynch plans to lean on 1) digital video and 2) paywalls to reach profitability.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eCondé's also \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/carlieporterfield/2020/12/15/anna-wintour-promoted-to-cond-nast-chief-content-officer-despite-diversity-criticism/?sh=25e23fa37b41\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estill responding\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to criticism over its treatment of Black employees, who have said they are marginalized. Wintour apologized for her role in sidelining Black creators in June. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eCondé may be changing its ways, but its most influential face is style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor a city whose symbol is a statue of a naked (or occasionally costumed) peeing child, Brussels doesn't mess around. Yesterday, European Union officials \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/eu-tech-restraints-gatekeepers-digital-services-markets-b7966063-aa23-4711-80f5-71c06a1aff6f.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereleased drafts\u003c/a\u003e of two strict new regulations for big tech. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDigital Markets Act\u003c/strong\u003e gives companies with extra big reach—45+ million monthly users or 10,000+ business customers—extra attention. These \"gatekeepers\" would need to disclose planned takeovers, face limits on using data they collect to launch competing products, and avoid favoring their own products on their platforms.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFines for violations could reach up to 10% of annual global revenue.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDigital Services Act\u003c/strong\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/business-media-bills-social-media-19038a8f0a68448ce6037308930a5efc?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewould\u003c/a\u003e make companies more accountable for illegal content on their platforms, with fines of up to 6% of annual revenue.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe walls are closing in\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis week, the FTC \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/amazon-facebook-among-targets-ftc-192247469.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eordered\u003c/a\u003e top U.S. tech companies to explain their user data practices, China \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2020/12/13/china-literature-alibaba-fined/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efined\u003c/a\u003e its own tech leaders Alibaba and Tencent over antitrust violations, and the UK \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/uk-plans-big-fines-online-companies-harmful-content-rcna198?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eproposed\u003c/a\u003e fines of up to 10% of global revenue if tech giants don't remove illegal content.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe EU proposals still need to be ratified, which could take a few years. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePresident-elect Joe Biden reportedly \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/12/15/politics/pete-buttigieg-transportation-secretary/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emade his pick\u003c/a\u003e for Transportation Secretary yesterday: former mayor of South Bend, IN, Pete Buttigieg. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRemember, it's BOOT-edge-edge—and he's the young one who \u003ca href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SxtvXaRe2lg\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espeaks Norwegian\u003c/a\u003e and \u003ca href=\"https://pitchfork.com/news/watch-pete-buttigieg-cover-spoons-the-way-we-get-by-on-piano/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplays alt-rock\u003c/a\u003e on the piano. Thirty-eight-year-old Mayor Pete ran a solid campaign for the Democratic nomination, even \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/biden-selects-pete-buttigieg-to-lead-transportation-department-11608059207?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003escraping out a win\u003c/a\u003e in the Iowa caucuses, but eventually dropped out of the race.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eButtigieg endorsed Biden and helped him raise money, despite Biden having run an ad mocking Buttigieg's relatively paltry experience. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat Buttigieg will be tasked with: \u003c/strong\u003eIt may be the Rhodes Scholar's toughest assignment yet—bipartisan infrastructure legislation. Biden's plan for climate change, a central plank of his platform, includes a major effort to overhaul the U.S.' crumbling industrial backbone. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eMore broadly, Buttigieg \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-15/biden-taps-former-rival-buttigieg-to-head-u-s-transportation?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill manage\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e a nearly $90 billion budget, plus oversee the agencies that regulate railroads, trucking, and aviation.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eif his nomination makes it through the Senate, Buttigieg will be the first openly LGBTQ person to become a member of a presidential Cabinet. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe're not sure watching football could get more fun than Monday night's Browns-Ravens game, but Nickelodeon is going to style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebroadcast\u003c/a\u003e an NFL Wild Card game filled with gags aimed at drawing in a younger audience. That means... \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA pregame show called \"The SpongeBob SportsPants Countdown Special\" \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBooth commentary from two members of the sketch comedy series \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eAll That\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSlime superimposed on endzones and googly eyes and other Snapchat-style filters layered over the game \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eWith the all-important TV rights deals for the NFL expiring in 2022, media companies, such as Nickelodeon parent ViacomCBS, are \u003ca href=\"https://variety.com/2020/tv/news/nfl-wild-card-nickelodeon-cbs-spongebob-squarepants-1234853731/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexperimenting\u003c/a\u003e with new formats to woo the league. NBC, for instance, is tapping khaki influencer and MSNBC journalist Steve Kornacki to evaluate playoff scenarios as he would the electoral college. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFood for thought: \u003c/strong\u003eWho makes your all-Nickelodeon football roster? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWRs: Drake \u0026
